qas.question: What did On the Genesis of Species argue against natural selection?
Who wrote On the Genesis of Species?
When did Charles Darwin first use the word "evolution" in On the Origin of Species?
What did Charles Darwin do to address Mivart's arguments?

context: In January 1871, <a1_0>George Jackson Mivart<a1_0/>'s On the Genesis of Species listed detailed arguments against natural selection, and <a0_0>claimed it included false metaphysics<a0_0/>. Darwin made extensive revisions to <a2_0>the sixth edition<a2_0/> of the Origin (this was the first edition in which he used the word "evolution" which had commonly been associated with embryological development, though all editions concluded with the word "evolved"), and <a3_0>added a new chapter VII,<a3_0/> <a4_0>Miscellaneous objections<a4_0/>, to address Mivart's arguments.
